item.title: Site
item.description: Once you have created a fieldbook, you can describe your the experimental site and its surroundings. • Site information - specifies the country and name of your experiment site. • Site description - provides details on the surroundings of your experiment site. • Soil classification might be known before the experiment starts and detailed in this section.

item.title: Crop measurements
item.description: In this section you can select and describe the measurements to be made on the crops. In case of intercropping or relay cropping trial, the measurements must be separately selected for the individual crops. Go to the Crop measurements tab of your fieldbook. In case of intercropping or relay cropping trial, start by selecting the tab corresponding to one of the crops of the trial.

item.title: Phenology measurements
item.description: In this section you can select phenological measurements to be made in the field. In case of an intercropping or a relay cropping trial, the measurements will be specified separately for each crop. Go to the Crop phenology tab of your fieldbook. In case of intercropping or relay cropping trial, start by selecting the tab corresponding to one of the crops of the trial. Select a measurement in the drop-down list.

item.title: Soil
item.description: This section is dedicated to the selection of soil measurements to make during the experiment. Go to the Soil tab of your fieldbook. In case of intercropping or relay cropping trial, start by selecting the tab corresponding to one of the crops of the trial. Select a measurement in the drop-down list. You can either scroll through the list or type the name of your measurement – the auto-complete feature will select the term if the measurement is in the list.

item.title: Weather
item.description: This section is dedicated to the selection of weather measurements to make during the experiment. Go to the Weather tab of your fieldbook. Select a measurement in the drop-down list. You can either scroll through the list or type the name of your measurement – the auto-complete feature will select the term if the measurement is in the list. Once you have found your measurement, select it and click on Add measurement.
